physical:
Deadlift
A) Warm up, then take 15:00 minutes build to a comfortable heavy set of 5.
Rest 2:00 between working sets.

B) Post-work: 3×15 Hip Thrusts.
Rest 1:00.

→ Track your effort — every day counts. Log it in the OMNIFIT app.
neurological: Hold a plank for 30–45 seconds. Keep hips still and breathe quietly.
cognitive: Choose one goal for the session and stick to it. When the mind drifts, bring it back kindly.
emotional: Breathe slow for two minutes after training. Let the body settle before moving on.
lifestyle: Eat a simple recovery meal within 60 minutes. Drink water before coffee.

physical:
5 sets:
10 Neutral-Grip Pull-ups
20 Push-ups.

Rest as needed

→ Track your effort — every day counts. Log it in the OMNIFIT app.
neurological: Hold a plank for 30–45 seconds. Keep hips still and breathe quietly.
cognitive: Choose one goal for the session and stick to it. When the mind drifts, bring it back kindly.
emotional: Breathe slow for two minutes after training. Let the body settle before moving on.

physical:
3 Rounds, 1:00 work for each station:
-Sit-Ups
-Walking Lunges
-Bear Crawl or Wall Walk
Rest 1:00 between rounds.

→ Track your effort — every day counts. Log it in the OMNIFIT app.
neurological: Stand on one leg for 30 seconds per side. Small corrections show learning.
cognitive: Pay attention to technique, not speed. Notice where control fades and reset gently.
emotional: Use box breathing for three rounds (:04 in, :04 out). Keep the exhale a touch longer.
lifestyle: Take a short walk after meals today. Gentle movement helps recovery.

physical:
18:00 EMOM
Work 30s / Rest 30s — Jump Rope or March in Place.
Keep breathing easy-nasal.

→ Track your effort — every day counts. Log it in the OMNIFIT app.
neurological: During the last minutes, focus on even cadence. Let arms and legs move smoothly.
cognitive: Keep attention on breathing and pace. Aim for a steady, conversational rhythm.
emotional: Take one quiet minute after finishing. Notice heart rate slowing with each exhale.
lifestyle: Get a few minutes of daylight in the morning. It supports energy across the day.

physical:
30:00 Brisk Walk.
Optional: light backpack (5-15% of Bodyweight).
-Walk tall, breathe easy.

→ Track your effort — every day counts. Log it in the OMNIFIT app.
neurological: During the last minutes, focus on even cadence. Let arms and legs move smoothly.
cognitive: Keep attention on breathing and pace. Aim for a steady, conversational rhythm.

physical:
A) 10 Rounds — For Quality
6 Goblet Lunges (alternating legs)
3 Lateral Burpees Over
1 Strict Pull-up
Rest 1:1; (If a round took 0:30s - Rest 0:30s)

B) Finisher: 
4 sets × 20 m Bottom-Up Carry / arm.
Build to Challenging Load
Rest as needed

→ Track your effort — every day counts. Log it in the OMNIFIT app.
neurological: After effort, balance on one leg for 45 seconds. Notice how fatigue changes control.
cognitive: When you want to stop, count three slow breaths first. Decide after the third breath.
emotional: Stay calm through the first urge to tense. Relax the shoulders and lengthen the exhale.
lifestyle: Plan a five-minute walk at sunset. Let the day slow down before screens.

physical:
Partner Workout
150 Push-Ups
250 Squats
- Split with a partner. Work while partner rests.

Solo Version, Accumulate:
100 Push-Ups
150 Squats

→ Track your effort — every day counts. Log it in the OMNIFIT app.
neurological: Hold a plank for 30–45 seconds. Keep hips still and breathe quietly.
cognitive: Choose one goal for the session and stick to it. When the mind drifts, bring it back kindly.
emotional: Breathe slow for two minutes after training. Let the body settle before moving on.
lifestyle: Eat a simple recovery meal within 60 minutes. Drink water before coffee.

physical:
20:00 Continuous Swim or Water Walk.
Keep effort easy and breathing relaxed.

→ Track your effort — every day counts. Log it in the OMNIFIT app.
neurological: Pick one simple control drill today, like single-leg balance. Keep posture calm.
cognitive: Pick one word for the day, like steady or kind. Return to it during transitions.
emotional: Pause for a short breathing break today. Calm is part of training, not extra.
lifestyle: Do one small habit on purpose today, like a short walk or extra water.

physical:
A) 1 round:
2:00 Cat–Cow
30 Slow Scapular Circles (band or no band, 15/side)

B) 4 rounds: 
20/side Suitcase March
15/side Reverse Wrist Curl
10/side Half-Kneeling Open Book

→ Track your effort — every day counts. Log it in the OMNIFIT app.
neurological: Do slow shoulder circles and ankle rolls for 1–2 minutes. Move easy and light.
cognitive: Write one line about how the body feels today. Keep it simple and honest.
emotional: Lie down and breathe calmly for three minutes. Soften the face and shoulders.
lifestyle: Go to bed a bit earlier tonight. Keep screens dim in the last hour.
